value.title: The hunt for Michigan's lost Democrats: Can Biden lure them back?
value.excerpt: Donald Trump won Michigan in 2016 with help from Democratic voters who backed him or didn't vote. Joe Biden will need their support to carry the state.

value.title: 'The president is likely toast': Trump's woes raise GOP fears of a blue wave
value.excerpt: "The president has had possibly the worst two-week stretch that a candidate could have going into the final month of an election," one Republican strategist said.

value.title: North Carolina Democrat's sex scandal renews GOP hopes of keeping majority despite Trump's drag on the ticket
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump's eroded political standing has hurt GOP senators in crucial races across the country, but Republicans now hope a sex scandal in North Carolina will help them fend off the Trump effect in a race that's central to holding the Senate majority.

value.title: Trump steel tariffs raised prices, shriveled up demand, led to job losses, some Michigan workers say
value.excerpt: "I don't see any policy that helped us. We are losing our damn jobs here," said the head of a steelworker union.

value.title: Philadelphia judge rejects Trump's poll-watcher lawsuit
value.excerpt: A local judge on Friday rejected an effort by the Trump campaign to send poll watchers to voting sites in Philadelphia, ruling that the campaign's attempted poll-watching isn't allowed under state law.

value.title: On economic aid, Trump seems to realize he 'messed up tactically'
value.excerpt: It dawned on the oft-confused president that sabotaging himself in the final four weeks of re-election campaign wasn't such a good idea.

value.title: What Makes Mike Pence’s Complicity So Chilling
value.excerpt: Somewhere under the cornfields and backyard hoop courts of Indiana is a small black box holding the conscience of Vice President Mike Pence. He buried it four years ago, when a tape emerged of Donald Trump boasting about sexually assaulting women.

value.title: Biden says he'll answer court-packing question 'when the election is over'
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden again ducked questions Thursday about whether he would seek to add seats to the Supreme Court, telling reporters he would not address the issue until after the November 3 election.

value.title: Pence does his best but Harris won't let him explain away Trump's failures
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence tried his best on Wednesday to recast the reality of Donald Trump's presidency, but Sen. Kamala Harris, the Democratic pick for his job, refused to let him spin away the nation's current dire plight during their single debate.

value.title: Analysis: This is Vice President Mike Pence's answer on a peaceful transfer of power. Read it carefully.
value.excerpt: The vice presidential debate Wednesday night will be remembered more for how the candidates evaded questions than how they answered them.

value.title: A Fly Landed on Mike Pence
value.excerpt: A local TV news reporter from California clocked the fly’s screen time on Mr. Pence’s head at 2 minutes, 3 seconds. While Mr. Pence spent most of the 90-minute debate avoiding direct questions posed by the moderator,

value.title: Pence attacks Biden for failing to rescue Kayla Mueller, who was held hostage by ISIS.
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence brought the parents of Kayla Mueller, the human rights activist who was killed in 2015 by members of the Islamic State in Syria, to the debate hall and attacked Joseph R. Biden Jr.

value.title: Newsom points to Trump to defend masking 'between bites' at restaurants
value.excerpt: Gavin Newsom pushed back hard Wednesday against Republicans and conservative media slamming his recent tweet calling for masks in between restaurant bites, flipping it back on President Donald Trump by saying critics should "soberly take a look at what's going on in the White House'' and consider the severe impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on Americans and the economy.

value.title: Trump tells White House doctor: ‘I feel great!’
value.excerpt: The President this morning says ‘I feel great!’” Trump's physician, Sean Conley, wrote in a memo released by the White House press office.

value.title: The Relief Deal Blowup: What are Pelosi and Trump Thinking?
value.excerpt: It’s not just the president’s wild back-and-forth on Twitter. Both sides are looking irrational on a deal that the economy is going to need soon.

value.title: Former CIA Director Hayden backs Biden, warns reelecting Trump would be 'very bad' for America
value.excerpt: Former CIA and NSA Director Michael Hayden on Wednesday warned that reelecting President Donald Trump would be "very bad for America" while endorsing Democratic nominee Joe Biden for president.

value.title: Stimulus latest: Trump tweets halt negotiations, meaning federal help for millions is not coming anytime soon
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump abruptly -- and single-handedly -- short-circuited stimulus negotiations on Tuesday, only to appear to reverse course eight hours later in a pair of tweets.

value.title: Russia's Vladimir Putin says he has noted Joe Biden's 'sharp anti-Russian rhetoric'
value.excerpt: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday he had noted what he called harsh anti-Russian rhetoric from Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden, but that he had been encouraged by Biden’s comments on arms control.

value.title: Mike Pence Brought Conservatives Home. What If They Don’t Need Him Anymore?
value.excerpt: Evangelical Christians were drawn to the vice president because he shared their values. But Trump’s style has made defiance of political norms, not a Pence specialty, seem appealing.

value.title: Pence preps for debate as chances to shake up the race dwindle
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence is set to square off with Sen. Kamala Harris at the vice presidential debate Wednesday in Salt Lake City just over one exceptionally long week since President Donald Trump faced former Vice President Joe Biden on the debate stage.

value.title: Biden says United States is in a 'dangerous place' and calls for unity in Gettysburg speech
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden warned of the "cost of division" Tuesday in a speech in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, delivering a call to turn past a moment he said is "neither good nor normal" and unify.

value.title: The Point: Donald Trump, dealmaker? Not so much.
value.excerpt: Donald Trump came to the White House promising that he would make deals the likes of which the country and the world never seen.

value.title: Tim Kaine on What It’s Like to Debate Mike Pence
value.excerpt: Mr. Kaine, Hillary Clinton’s running mate in 2016, spoke to The Times about what lies ahead for Senator Kamala Harris at Wednesday’s V.P. debate.

value.title: Fact check: Trump falsely tweets that Covid-19 is less lethal than the flu
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump has consistently downplayed the threat of the coronavirus in public, and it seems testing positive for the virus himself has not changed his tune.

value.title: Bernstein on Trump: He has become homicidally negligent
value.excerpt: CNN political analyst Carl Bernstein reacts to the White House declining an offer from the CDC to help contact trace the coronavirus outbreak in the White House.

value.title: Biden describes the first debate as a 'clownish undertaking'
value.excerpt: Joe Biden was asked about his first debate with President Trump, and if he could stand up to his opponent in the future. He said the debate frustrated him but should have described it as a "clownish undertaking" instead of calling the president a clown.

value.title: Eric Trump scheduled to sit for deposition Monday in New York attorney general investigation
value.excerpt: Eric Trump, who runs day-to-day operations of the family real estate empire, is scheduled to sit for a deposition on Monday as part of the New York attorney general's investigation into whether the Trump Organization improperly inflated the value of its assets to obtain loans or tax benefits.

value.title: Meadows: ‘Still optimistic’ Trump will leave hospital later on Monday
value.excerpt: Trump's chief of staff said the president will meet with his doctors and nurses on Monday morning to assess his progress.

value.title: Trump told Woodward in March he didn't have 'a lot of time' to meet with Fauci in newly released audio
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump in March said he didn't have "a lot of time" to meet with Dr. Anthony Fauci as the coronavirus pandemic surged across the US, according to newly released audio from an interview with journalist Bob Woodward.

value.title: Russians ‘Have Committed’ to Not Interfering in Elections, Trump Aide Insists
value.excerpt: Robert C. O’Brien, the national security adviser, said he warned his Russian counterpart there would be “no tolerance” for interference, but didn’t mention evidence of Moscow’s influence operations.
